alert.note: Alert for Harris; Waller (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 17 at 6:23AM CDT until May 17 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Cypress Creek at Katy-Hockley Road affecting Waller and Harris Counties. For the Cypress Creek...including Katy-Hockley Road...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cypress Creek at Katy-Hockley Road. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 157.3 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins in the vicinity of the gage as water escapes the main channel and spills into the floodplain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM CDT Wednesday, May 17 the stage was 157.02 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain around flood stage. - Flood stage is 157.3 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 156.9 feet on 03/30/2001. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Cypress Creek Katy-Hockley Roa 157.3 157.0 Wed 5 am CDT 155.3 153.7 151.9 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1100 AM CDT.
